questions.question: What force(s) act(s) on a free-falling object in vacuum?
Which equation represents the velocity of a free-falling object as a function of time?
What determines the magnitude of the drag force experienced by an object falling through a fluid?

answers.b: Projected area of the object only

questions.question: What is the drag coefficient used to quantify?

answers.a: The drag or resistance of an object in a fluid environment
answers.d: The projected area of the object

questions.question: What is the condition for an object reaching terminal velocity in a fluid?

answers.a: When the drag force exceeds the gravitational force
answers.b: When the gravitational force exceeds the drag force
answers.c: When the net force on the object is zero
answers.d: When the object is released from a height

questions.question: Which equipment is used to detect the passing of the object in the experiment?
What is the purpose of maintaining the cylindrical chamber in a vacuum?

answers.c: To measure the coefficient of drag
answers.d: To measure the acceleration due to gravity accurately

questions.question: How can the terminal velocity of the object be determined experimentally?

answers.a: By measuring the time taken for the object to pass through each light gate
answers.c: By calculating the projected area of the object
answers.d: By setting the electromagnet to different power levels
